Define Data Required (Data Layer)Now know formula, identify ingredients.need lab_results table LIMS?need patient_demographics table EMR?need join PatientID?tables speak language? (e.g., one use “M/F” “Male/Female”?)4. Build Dashboard (Visual Layer) now, steps 1–3, open Power BI canvas. defined indicator, know exactly measures write. visuals become simple containers logic.

text: Use question : “category higher lower?”Best choice: Bar Chart (Horizontal preferred): Length easier human eye compare area (pie charts) angles. Labels easier read horizontally, especially long names like Districts Facilities.Good examples: Performance District, Coverage Facility, Uptake Age Group.Avoid: Pie charts (hard compare slices); Stacked bars (totals differ significantly).Tip: Always sort bar charts. unsorted chart just random list. sorted chart leaderboard.

chapter: Chapter: 8 Designing Dashboards People Actually Use
heading: 8.3.3 Visuals for Ranking and Priority Setting
text: Use question : “performing best worst?”Best choice: Sorted Bar ChartEnhancements: Sort Descending (Highest Lowest) show top performers, Ascending identify facilities needing support.supports: Resource allocation, targeted follow-, accountability discussions.

chapter: Chapter: 8 Designing Dashboards People Actually Use
heading: 8.3.4 Visuals for Composition (Parts of a Whole)
text: Use question : “makes total?”Best choices: Stacked Bar Chart 100% Stacked BarUse Pie Charts : 2 3 categories (e.g., Male/Female) differences obvious.Avoid Pie Charts : many categories (e.g., 10 Districts) values close (49% vs 51%).Rule Thumb: users argue slice bigger, visual wrong.

chapter: Chapter: 8 Designing Dashboards People Actually Use
heading: 8.3.5 Visuals for Geographic Patterns
text: Use question : “performance high low?”Best choice: Map (Used carefully)Maps powerful dangerous.Use : Geography message (e.g., identifying cluster outbreaks).Avoid : Exact comparison required. hard compare size bubble North vs bubble South.Always pair maps : bar chart table precise comparison.

chapter: Chapter: 8 Designing Dashboards People Actually Use
heading: 8.4 Why Tables Still Matter
text: Tables failure design. essential :Exact numbers matter (e.g., financial reporting drug stock levels).Data needs exported.Users want verify calculations.Power BI Tip: Use Matrix visual instead standard Table visual. Matrix acts like Excel Pivot Table, allowing users drill rows (e.g., click “Region” expand “Districts”) aggregate columns.

chapter: Chapter: 8 Designing Dashboards People Actually Use
heading: 8.5 Avoiding Common Visualization Mistakes
text: Watch warning signs:many visuals: doesn’t fit one screen, belongs new page.Traffic Light Abuse: Don’t color everything Red/Green. overwhelming. Use color highlight exceptions (e.g., red “50% Target”).Pie Charts Comparison: Never use pie chart compare 15 districts.KPIs without Context: number saying “5,000 Tested” means nothing. good? Bad? Better last month? Always provide context (e.g., “% Target” “vs Last Month”).

chapter: Chapter: 8 Designing Dashboards People Actually Use
heading: 8.6 Interaction Should Support Thinking
text: Interactivity Power BI’s superpower, intentional.Cross-Highlighting: Clicking “Male” bar filter rest page show Male data.Drill-: Allow users move Summary Detail (e.g., Year > Quarter > Month).Tooltips: Use hover-tooltips provide extra detail without cluttering screen.Technical Tip: clicking one chart makes another chart look confusing, use “Edit Interactions” button Format ribbon turn interaction specific visuals.

chapter: Chapter: 8 Designing Dashboards People Actually Use
heading: 8.9 Bonus: Measures Used in This Chapter
text: complete hands-exercises chapter, create following measures Measures table.Total Patient VisitsTotal ART ClientsMalaria Tests ConductedTB Tests ConductedThese measures intentionally simple. purpose support visual reasoning, advanced DAX patterns.
code:
Total Patient Visits :=
COUNTROWS ( fact_patient_visits )Total ART Clients :=
CALCULATE (
    COUNTROWS ( fact_patient_visits ),
    fact_patient_visits[service_type] = "ART"
)Malaria Tests Conducted :=
CALCULATE (
    COUNTROWS ( fact_patient_visits ),
    fact_patient_visits[service_type] = "Malaria Test"
)TB Tests Conducted :=
CALCULATE (
    COUNTROWS ( fact_patient_visits ),
    fact_patient_visits[service_type] = "TB Test"
)
